ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This course is well worth taking for a student who wants to learn more about practical and theoretical stuff about bioinformatics. I would recommend it to students in CBB since it's rather useful.

If you're interested in bioinformatics you should of course take this. However, even if you're not but you are fascinated by understanding the frontier of research going on in a field I'd recommend it as well. The psets may be difficult, but the opportunity to take a peek at the future of how we understand and analyze the human genome is an opportunity that few will get.
I would certainly recommend this course to other students. It covers alot of useful information and sequence analysis methods.

I would summarize it as a walkthrough of DNA variant, RNA-seq, and DNA methylation analysis methods. I would recommend the course to another student, mostly because the homework assignments, though too long in their current form, were extremely valuable (perhaps because of the complexity).

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Showing statistical methodology gives more views in my knowledge of bioinformatics.

This course expanded my knowledge of sequence analysis methods while affording me exposure to useful programs. I imagine that this should be useful in other classes and aspects of my research project.
